clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluating Adapted Structured Clinical Management for People With a Diagnosis of Personality Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating Adapted Structured Clinical Management for People With a Diagnosis of Personality Disorder

brief_summary.textblock: Camden and Islington NHS Foundation Trust in London has a Personality Disorder Service (PDS) which offers a number of evidence-based interventions to people with a diagnosis of Personality Disorder. One team in the PDS, the Community Team, offers an adapted form of Structured Clinical Management (SCM; Bateman and Kravitz, 2013). As these adaptations are novel, this study aims to formally explore the effectiveness of this intervention, through a sample of clients under the team, with outcomes (proxy measures of distress such as inpatient admissions) pre- and post- intervention.

primary_outcome.time_frame: One year pre-referral and one year post-allocation
primary_outcome.description: Inpatient admissions, safeguarding concerns, crisis centre contacts, crisis house admissions, criminal justice contacts.

arm_group.description: 27 adult clients under PDS Community Team

intervention.description: Adapted form of a previous Evidence Based Treatment- adapted to local context, in light of input from service-users and commissioners.

study_pop.textblock: Adults with a diagnosis of Personality Disorder, under the care of Camden and Islington PDS.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Allocated to a care coordinator at the PDS for greater than one year (a reasonable time period for therapeutic rapport to form and the effect of the intervention to manifest).
Exclusion Criteria:
- No existing notes for one year prior to allocation.
- No primary diagnosis of Personality Disorder.

facility.name: Camden and Islington Personality Disorder Service
